metadata.title: CVE-2012-2819 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The texSubImage2D implementation in the WebGL subsystem in Google Chromebefore 20.0.1132.43 does not properly handle uploads to floating-pointtextures, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(assertion failure and application crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a crafted web page, as demonstrated by certain WebGLperformance tests, aka rdar problem 11520387.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2819` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-browser-l10n - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-chromedriver - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5').
